metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 35 axioms covering plan elements including conditional actions, repetitive structures, preconditions, subplans, and temporal plan structures
metadata.notation: First-order logic with defeasible reasoning, temporal structures, and plan element definitions

axioms.title: Conditional actions relate to agent goals
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 e2 a) (if (and (cond e e1 e2)(agentOf a e2)(etc)) (exists (g) (and (goal g a) (or (enable e1 g)(not' g e1))))))
axioms.english: If there is a conditional action by an agent a, then either the condition enables a goal of a's or the negation of the condition is a goal of a's. In the first case the agent is exploiting the occurrence of the condition. In the second he is escaping from the consequences of the condition. In either case, the condition is relevant to his goals.

axioms.title: WhileDo negation goal
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 e2 a) (if (and (whileDo e e1 e2)(agentOf a e2)(etc)) (exists (e0) (and (not' e0 e1)(goal e0 a)))))
axioms.english: The negation of the condition in a whileDo is defeasibly a goal of the agent's. That's why the agent keeps executing the body until the condition is gone.

axioms.title: RepeatUntil termination goal
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 e2 a) (if (and (repeatUntil e e1 e2)(agentOf a e1)(etc)) (goal e2 a)))
axioms.english: A similar rule holds for repeatUntil. The termination condition e2 is defeasibly a goal of the agent's.

axioms.title: Definition of partialSubplan
axioms.fol: (forall (p1 p c) (iff (partialSubplan p1 p c) (exists (a g1) (and (subplan p1 p)(plan p1 a g1) (partialPlan p1 a g1 c)))))
axioms.english: A partial subplan is one in which the terminal nodes are not all executable, given a set of constraints c.

axioms.title: Definition of subplanAgent
axioms.fol: (forall (a p1 p) (iff (subplanAgent a p1 p) (and (subplan p1 p) (forall (e) (if (and (subgoalIn e p1) (exists (a1) (agentOf a1 e))) (agentOf a e))))))
axioms.english: Someone is a subplan agent if they are the agent of every action in the subplan. That is, a is the agent of every subgoal in the subplan p1 that has an agent.

axioms.title: Definition of planTermination
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (iff (planTermination e p) (exists (a g) (and (subgoalIn e p)(plan p a g) (forall (e1) (if (subgoalIn e1 p)(not (before e e1)))) (causalComplex p g)(cause e g)))))
axioms.english: The termination of a plan is the final action in the plan, after which the goal is achieved.

axioms.title: Definition of knowledgePrecondition
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e) (iff (knowledgePrecondition e1 e) (exists (a e2) (and (enable e1 e)(know' e1 a e2)))))
axioms.english: A knowledge precondition is the eventuality of someone a knowing something e2 where that knowing is an enabling condition in the causal complex for e.

axioms.title: Definition of resourcePrecondition
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e) (iff (resourcePrecondition e1 e) (exists (a s x e2) (and (at' e1 x a s)(enable e1 e2)(changeIn' e2 x) (causallyInvolved e2 e)))))
axioms.english: A resource precondition involves having a resource at hand that enables an action through undergoing change that is causally involved in the effect. What distinguishes both resources and tools is that they go through a change of state (perhaps location) and that change plays an intermediate causal role in the effect occurring.

axioms.title: Definition of conditionalPlan
axioms.fol: (forall (p a g) (iff (conditionalPlan p a g e) (exists (e1) (and (plan p a g)(cond p e e1)))))
axioms.english: A conditional plan is a plan whose corresponding event is a conditional event. That is, p is a plan of a's to achieve goal g, executed only when condition e occurs.

axioms.title: Definition of repetitivePlan
axioms.fol: (forall (p a g) (iff (repetitivePlan p a g) (exists (e1 e2) (and (plan p a g) (or (whileDo p e1 e2)(repeatUntil p e1 e2))))))
axioms.english: A repetitive plan is a plan with a 'while do' or 'repeat until' structure.

axioms.title: Definition of periodicSubplan
axioms.fol: (forall (p1 p) (iff (periodicSubplan p1 p) (exists (t) (and (subplan p1 p)(timeSpanOf t p1) (periodicTseq t)))))
axioms.english: Periodic subplans can be defined as plans whose time spans are periodic temporal sequences.

axioms.title: Definition of requiredPrecondition
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 e) (iff (requiredPrecondition e0 e) (exists (e1 e2) (and (or' e e1 e2)(enable e0 e1)(enable e0 e2)))))
axioms.english: A required precondition is an eventuality that is an enabling condition for a disjunctive effect. That is, it is a precondition of each disjunct.

conversion_notes.reified_predicates: Moderate use of primed predicates for mental states and temporal relations: not', know', at', changeIn', or'
conversion_notes.defeasible_reasoning: 3 axioms use (etc) condition for defeasible reasoning about goal-action relationships in conditional, whileDo, and repeatUntil structures
conversion_notes.temporal_structures: Integration of temporal reasoning with plan structure through whileDo, repeatUntil, periodicTseq, and before predicates
conversion_notes.precondition_taxonomy: Systematic classification of preconditions into knowledge and resource types based on enabling relationships
conversion_notes.cross_references: Heavy integration with plan theory (Chapter 31), temporal reasoning (Chapter 16), causality (Chapter 15), and goal theory (Chapter 28)
conversion_notes.plan_element_framework: Comprehensive categorization of plan components including conditional, repetitive, and periodic structures
conversion_notes.causal_structure: Integration of causal complex theory for plan termination and resource preconditions
conversion_notes.agent_role_analysis: Systematic treatment of agent roles in subplans and action sequences

file_format_notes.logical_structure: Mix of simple definitions and complex nested quantification, especially in planTermination and subplanAgent
file_format_notes.predicate_consistency: Consistent use of plan element terminology with clear semantic distinctions between element types
file_format_notes.defeasibility_markers: Proper identification of defeasible rules using (etc) predicate in goal-action relationship axioms
file_format_notes.reification_patterns: Selective reification focused on mental states, temporal relations, and logical operators
file_format_notes.temporal_integration: Sophisticated integration of temporal structures with plan organization and execution
